conclusion: Analyze the motion of particles A and B based on the velocity-time graph.
The graph shows the velocity of each particle as a function of time.
Both particles start from rest at the same time, so their initial velocity is 0.
Particle A travels at twice the speed of particle B initially.
Since particle A travels at twice the speed of particle B, the time taken for A to reach a certain velocity is half that of B.
Particle A travels from 0 to 2v_0 in the first time interval, while particle B travels from 0 to 3v_0 in the same time interval.
A and B meet when they reach the same velocity.
Since A travels from 0 to 2v_0, the time taken for A to reach this velocity is t_0.
Since B travels from 0 to 3v_0, the time taken for B to reach this velocity is also t_0.
Since both particles reach the same velocity at the same time, the time when A and B meet is 2t_0.
The graph confirms that the two particles meet at the point where their velocity is 2v_0, which corresponds to the time 2t_0.
